alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 5:33AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Stormy Week Ahead... A weather system moving through the Bering Sea will reach the Yukon Delta Friday afternoon. Snowfall with this system will move north and east Friday evening into Saturday and will bring 3-8 inches of snow south of the Bering Strait Friday afternoon into Saturday morning, with 1-4 inches north of the Bering Strait Friday night and Saturday. A second, much stronger storm, will move into the Western Bering Sea on Saturday. This system will spread blizzard conditions and heavy snow over the West Coast Saturday night, with heavy snowfall moving into the Western Interior on Sunday. Up to a foot of snow is possible Saturday night into Monday across the Northwest Arctic as well as over portions of the Seward Peninsula. There is a chance of mixed or freezing precipitation south of the Bering Strait Saturday night through Sunday as well. This second storm will bring southwest gales blowing across the Bering Sea Saturday into Monday, and across the Chukchi Sea Sunday into Monday. This will bring the possibility of coastal flooding along the West Coast Sunday into Monday. At this time it looks similar to the storm surge and flooding that occurred along the West Coast a week and a half ago. Stay tuned to weather.gov/fairbanks for the latest forecast updates.
